description: 'Generate and reuse spacing in design systems.'
---

import spacingDiagram from './spacing-diagram.png';

The consistent and intentional use of a spacing system creates a more harmonious experience for the end user. A spacing system also lays a foundation for responsive design and customisable UI density in the future, which will enhance the overall quality and accessibility of our products.

## Basic usage

```ts
import { Spacing } from '@bitdesign/sparks.foundations.spacing';

const spacing = Spacing.create();
```

## Default spacing

The default base unit is `8px`, with three spacing segments: `small`, `medium` and `large`:

<img src={spacingDiagram} width={750} />

## Customize spacing

You can customize spacing using the [SpacingOptions](/) by changing existing configuration or for the default segments:

```ts
import { Spacing } from '@bitdesign/sparks.foundations.spacing';

const spacing = Spacing.create({
  baseUnit: 4, // base unit in pixels, used to compute spacing. 
  small: {
    multiplier: 0.25, // multiplier for the small spacing segment.
    levels: 5 // number of levels to include in the small spacing segment. 
  },
});
```

Add new segments by adding new keys to your spacing options:

```ts
import { Spacing } from '@bitdesign/sparks.foundations.spacing';

const spacing = Spacing.create({
  baseUnit: 4, // base unit in pixels, used to compute spacing. 
  xl: {
    multiplier: 1.25,
    levels: 3
  }
});
```
